risk_factors.reasoning: 10 previous arrests suggest a history of involvement in criminal activity
At 18 years old, he is still relatively young and the risk of rearrest may decrease over time
Only held one job in a year suggests limited employment history, but not necessarily an indication of instability
History of drug use increases the likelihood of continued involvement in criminal activity
Living alone as a young adult may contribute to increased isolation and decreased social support
Possession of a GED certificate does not necessarily indicate employability or stability
Grew up in a household of size 4 may suggest some level of support, but lack of current involvement in family life raises concerns
Absence of recent depression suggests no significant mental health issues
